Windows Fast Startup works in a similar way to Windows Vista's Fast Startup feature.
In Windows 8, this feature is called Quick Access and can be enabled on the BIOS.
text:
Fast Startup is a Windows feature that allows you to boot your computer in a few seconds rather than a minute.
Rather than going through the cold boot path, Fast Startup uses a minimal hiberfile to resume the system.
When the feature is enabled, selecting Shutdown in the Windows UI doesn t actually shutdown the system.

Mean, mode, and median are different types of averages.
The mode is the most commonly occuring element in a sample.

instruction: Please explain why adding more indexes to a relational database is not always beneficial for speeding up workloads.
